story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled at the foot of a great mountain, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Aisha. Aisha was known throughout the village for her compassion, her love of learning, and her devotion to her faith.

One day, Aisha overheard her friends talking about the mysterious cave that lay high up on the side of the mountain. They said that no one had ever been inside, and that it was guarded by a wise old sage who would only allow the most pure of heart to enter.

Aisha was fascinated by this tale and decided that she must see the cave for herself. She packed a small bag with some food, water, and a few essential belongings, and set off on the long journey up the mountain.

The climb was steep and treacherous, but Aisha was determined and did not falter. As she reached the top, she saw the entrance to the cave, guarded by a venerable old man. The sage looked at her with piercing eyes and asked, "Why have you come here, young one?"

"I have come to seek wisdom and knowledge," replied Aisha.

The sage studied her for a moment, then nodded. "Very well. But first, you must prove your worthiness. Answer me this: What is the greatest gift that Allah has given to mankind?"

Aisha thought for a moment. "The greatest gift that Allah has given to mankind is the gift of free will," she said confidently.

Impressed, the sage smiled. "You are indeed a wise and pure-hearted young person. Enter the cave and receive the blessings within."

Aisha stepped into the cave and found it filled with radiant light. She saw beautiful tapestries depicting scenes from the Quran, sparkling gems and precious metals, and scrolls upon scrolls filled with ancient knowledge and wisdom.

As she explored the cave, Aisha discovered that each scroll contained a different lesson, each more valuable than the last. She spent hours in the cave, learning and absorbing all that she could.

Eventually, the light began to fade, and Aisha knew it was time to return home. She thanked the sage and promised to share the lessons she had learned with her family and friends.

From that day on, Aisha was known throughout the land as a beacon of knowledge and wisdom, and she spent her days sharing her blessings with all who would listen.

And so, my dear daughter, as you drift off to sleep, remember that just like Aisha, you too have been given the gift of free will. Use it wisely, learn from your experiences, and share your blessings with others.

Goodnight, my dear. May your dreams be filled with the light of knowledge and the beauty of wisdom. Ameen.
